Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Kinney
Reviews.Content: I exchanged a Canon SX100 for this camera, and I am so glad I did.  This camera is lightening fast with flash shots (compared to the VERY SLOW Canon).  Indoor pictures are great as well as outdoor.  I have taken a ton of pictures and very few have been slightly blurry, most come out clear with good color. Flash looks natural, as opposed to the canon which would either over or under expose shots.  I love that the camera is compact and small enough to fit in a regular camera case, but yet still has the long reach 10x optical zoom.  I also love the 3" LCD.Pros:-Compact with 10x optical zoom-3" LCD-Good indoor photos-No delay in between shots-Battery meter always showing-Slide show with music is too cool!Cons:  (Very minor and do not take away from camera at all)-No automatic lens cover (has lens cap)-No zoom in video mode (although if I want great video, I'll use my video camera)-Comes with Shoulder strap - I prefer wrist strap (Fixed by ordering a wrist strap off ebay for $2)If you want a compact camera with a lot of zoom and good quality pictures, definitely go with this one.  The only other cameras that have same features:  Canon SX100 (too slow between flash, indoor shots are not good), Panasonic TZ3 (reviews say picture quality not good), and Canon G9 (only has 6x zoom and has a hefty price tag).  To me, the Sony is the way to go for the average shooter who mainly shoots in automatic mode but occasionally plays with other settings.  I have owned for about a week, if anything changes, I will update my review, but so far - GREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great high zoom camera without the weight and bulk
Reviews.Author: Elana  Gabriele
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about three weeks and have taken several hundred pictures with it.  It takes excellent pictures with amazing detail and color.  Despite the fact that I am often photographing moving children, fewer than 5% of the pictures have been blurry.  This camera's ability to take excellent action shots with no blur is one of its strongest features, in my opinion.  A second superior feature of the camera, relative to the last camera I bought recently and returned (Canon Powershot SX 100IS) is the fast next shot delay.  This camera is ready to take another picture, even after using the flash, relatively quickly. I say "relatively" because there is still a delay, but compared to the sluggish Canon, it is a great improvement.  If you don't have the flash on, then the next shot delay is very fast.  Also, the time the camera is ready to take the first picture from the time I take it out of the camera bag is quite short.I have tried taking close up pictures of jewelry with the macro setting, which is only a one-button press.  I thought it did a pretty decent job, although I did have to play around with the lighting to make sure that the flash didn't get reflected.Another superior feature of this camera, relative to the Canon mentioned above, is the operation of the zoom. I find that I can control the exact amount of zoom with the button, whereas with the Canon, the zoom seemed to jump discontinuously.For the amount of power (meaning the 10x zoom) and precision of this camera, it is very light (under a pound) and compact. I was able to take a whole series of shots at the playground using just one hand with no trouble, and the weight of the camera did not cause my hand to get tired.Another feature I really like is that after taking a bunch of pictures, you can review them as a slide show with music and special effects.  I did this at the end of a dinner party and was able to instantly show guests a slide show of the dinner on the camera.As far as negative features, there are only two that I have discovered.  The first is that there is a lens cap that has to be put on and taken off manually. You attach the cap to the camera strap with a string, so it's not a big problem; just a little inconvenient.  In contrast, Canons' lens covers are built in, and the lens is covered with just a press of a button. The second negative feature is common to all Sony products and that is their proprietary accessories.  The camera requires a Sony rechargeable battery (one comes with the camera, as does the recharger, but I bought an extra one) and a Sony pro-duo memory card.  For me this is worth it because I really like Sony cameras.In summary, I think this camera takes excellent pictures while being lightweight and compact.  It's a good camera for a person like me, who often wants to take pictures of kids moving without having to mess with a bunch of settings to change the camera speed.  I am very happy with this camera and highly recommend it to people who have similar needs. Sony Cybershot DSCH10/B 8.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H10 Perfect For Travel
Reviews.Author: Harlan Aliment
Reviews.Content: Tired of carrying around a much larger SLR camera with interchangeable lenses and small view screen I found the H10 a very nice replacement. The 10X zoom is more then enough for my travel picture needs. In Alaska I zoomed in on a bald eagle resting on a distant electrical tower. The large 3" viewing screen allows me to compose my picture without wearing any glasses. Mode selector knob easily allows me to find the right picture taking mode. Virtually no shot delay and multiple shooting mode works machine gun fast. Steady shot is always on, removing any moves I may make and later blaming on the camera. Taking pictures at twilight and night resulted in very high quality pictures. Issues? With a 4gb memory chip I tend to overshoot, bringing my battery to exhaustion. No problem, added an extra battery and off I go. Yes you can read where other reviewers will complain about what the H10 will not do. Then again, if you take the time to fully read the manual several times, practice with the camera and learn from your mistakes, you will find the camera is fine. It's the operator making the mistakes. Nice job Sony!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely dazzled
Reviews.Author: Ana Margarita
Reviews.Content: PROS: Big screen, great zoom, lightweight, conventional cap, great flash, many features even fancy ones (music and so).CONS: None.It is a good camera, something not too pro, but with so many features that you'll feel like a pro. Specially the zoom (10x, wow!). The big screen, despite delicate, helps to detect blurs that cannot be easily appreciated in smaller screens (it gets greasy easily, so use a plastic screen protector). However, I would qualify the zoom, at its full length, with an 8, so far. Sometimes it is blurry (very little, but is), and sometimes not (in similar conditions shots), so I guess that it is not a 100% steady, but is ok considering its competitors (minor zoom and even more sensitive to movement). Just hold it firmly.The lack of built-cap I cannot be sure if it is one of the "cons" because I had two Canon before this Sony and both suffered damage in its cap at any point (It did not close properly, it bended, did not open, etc.), so an old fashioned cap is ok as long as you fix a thread (are many on the market) to avoid losing it.I like the flash also. It is strong, long and has different ways to use it: there is one that allows illuminating the whole scene, instead of just the proximity, so it is very useful for indoor pictures. You'll get beautifully illuminated interiors, with or without people. This is different from my previous Canon cameras.It takes time to become a pro in the use of all its features. It has plenty. If you just want to focus and shot, then buy something less expensive. The features are promisingly great, but I am not so fast using it, I take my time. If you are going to a trip, is better that you become more than familiar with this little thing before so it can do a great job. Otherwise you will find yourself shooting in automatic all the time, and if that is so, why this camera then?UPDATE, FROM A TRIP (2009):I have just returned from a three week holiday with my husband and my 3 y.o. boy. I shoot more than 2000 pics... it's crazy, but the camera is so powerful and versatile that you enjoy shooting around.This wonderful machine survived my boy, an outrageous number of shots, some strikes, bad weather, many bumps, etc. It's like the Jungle Jeep of Digital Cameras. My two previous Canons were not successful in similar conditions (the automatic cap was the first thing to fail and at the end it was necessary for me to open it with my fingers).The more I used this Sony, the more I was in love with it. While in vacations you need to be very familiar with different settings to get the picture (i.e. in a sightseeing tour, a museum where no flash is allowed) and sometimes everything happens so fast that you really need to change settings right away to get that shot. Well, this camera is like having many cameras with me:- When it was very sunny outside, I used ISO 100 and I got wonderful blue skies, when it started to rain, I changed ISO to 400, when it was getting darker, to ISO 800. When I was in a museum where no flashes were allowed, I used my high ISO and so on.- When I wanted to get beautiful landscapes at night, I used M (manual) settings, easy to use, with lovely results.- When I wanted to do some beautiful B/W pictures or Sepia, or change size to landscape, it was very easy.- When I wanted to make skylines or just silhouettes, I changed the point feature and pointed to the source of light (taking care of my eyes) and the results were beautiful. I.e. There were lovely colorful skies, so I pointed to them behind a nice sculpture.- I also had a lot of fun by using the flash (never before I had enjoyed the flash so much) because the "flash keeping landscape clear" really does it. I mean, no more beautifully lighten people in a dark surrounding.- It was very easy to use a tripod, and knowing the settings of the camera I enjoyed to make self portraits of me with my family. I recommend the "Gorilla pod". I attached it to the stroller everywhere! Having a little boy, I learnt to make sequences of shoots with the auto-shutter.I have recently purchased the Telephoto and adapter rings to use my old filters with this camera. Once I have tried them enough I would write the proper reviews.UPDATE, 3 YEARS LATER (2011):This camera has been a joy. Unfortunately it has started to fail. Early this year I had a problem with the zoom and I got it fixed, happy again. But just returning from another trip the flash has gone. It actually pops out and everything but the light doesn't come out. I will not get this repaired since it is expensive and I am afraid that it may have some other issues inside just about to come into surface. It been a  lovely camera: survived many trips and tons of nice pics despite my roughness and adverse weather conditions. I WILL BUY ANOTHER JUST LIKE THIS ONE. I think that this is the best recommendation for any product.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Rustybear "lambchoppy"
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera most of all for its speed in taking the pictures, captured my dog so clearly as he was jumping in the air, awesome!! Zoom is great. I would have kept this camera for the great pictures but the following reasons really annoyed me:  1. the lens cap has to be taken off manually, hangs by a string, no clip to attach to the camera strap. If you don't take it completly off it gets in the way of shooting.  2. the on/off button is very tiny and is flush on the top of the camera making it sometimes difficult to turn on or off especially in a hurry.  3. no delete button, have to go through too many steps to delete a picture.  4. should be an indentation on the back for your thumb to rest and a better grip.

Reviews.Title: Compared several and this is the keeper!
Reviews.Author: Brooke "turtle"
Reviews.Content: I tried several cameras before deciding to stick with this one. Other cameras I tried were the Canon sx100is, Panasonic Lumix TZ4, Kodak Easyshare Z712, and finally the Canon S5. I really expected to like the Canon S5 the best, but this little camera out shot the Canon in most all conditions. The Sony, in my opinion, gave me the ability to quickly take pictures that consistently turned out well. The video is nice quality as long as you use the 'fine' mode. This is a nice little camera and I enjoy using it!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Burch
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 6 months and have enjoyed it a lot!  It takes great pictures and has lots of different options.  The only trouble I've had is the lens cap does not attach to anything, so it swings around all over the place when I'm taking pictures.  I solved this by attaching velcro to the front of the cap and the side of the strap.  The other thing I do not like is that the dial on the top tends to move quite easily and sometimes I find myself taking pictures on a setting I did not plan on.  I just fix it and retake the picture, but it's a little annoying.  I do love, however, the movie feature.  They are very clear and upload to our computer/blog easily.  My family loves seeing pictures and movies of my kids - especially family that is out of town.  All in all, this is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Worth the money spent
Reviews.Author: Lynn D. Walther "String Lover"
Reviews.Content: I am highly impressed by this digital camera made by Sony. This camera is as close to a digital SLR as you can get without paying three times the amount of money. This camera is loaded with special features just like any quality SLR digital camera. Crisp photos that you are able to blow up to poster sized photographs. Before spending a high amount of money on a SLR read the features that this camera comes equipped with.

Reviews.Title: Sony Rules
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Cole Jr.
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this camera, it was a toss up between the Sony and the Canon G9 (Not a Panasonic fan so the Lumix was not an option). Although the Canon has more megapixels and costs a hundred or so more, I found the Sony to be the better choice. The Sony is more compact and lightweight, and offers more optical zoom than the Canon. Obviously I am not a professional photographer, but as a dad with three children this was the better choice for me for sports, concerts, special moments, and the like. It is a great camera for the buyer who wants both the auto feature with a great deal of zoom, and for the more more experienced and adventerous shooter who seeks out manual controls. It is not a pocket-sized camera, but it is very compact for the features it offers. I uploaded two photos (Bumble Bee and Zucchini) that I ordered in 5x7 prints and the quality and clarity amazed me. This is my second Cyber-Shot and I am completely satisfied. Cybershot H10 8.1 Megapixel Digital Camera Black

Reviews.Title: Sweet zoom!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Savage
Reviews.Content: This camera has enabled me to take equally great photos at my kids' Little League games and when out seeing bands - and so much more. The videos are awesome. All-around easy to use point-and-shoot with excellent zoom ability. A good option before the SLR-like model step.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: goldilocks "love amazon.com"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera.  I love this camera!  I knew from friends who had digital cameras that there is a long wait time between shooting and getting the picture.  I chose this one because Consumer Reports said most Sony Cybershots have a fast shooting time.  This camera is very fast!  I have shot lightning shots, very close macro shots.  The pictures are detailed and clear.  There are alot of options on this camera, and especially love the ISO feature.  Would recommend this camera to all digital camera lovers.  One issue is that the camera did not come with a memory card, and since it was my first digital camera did not know needed this.  Also, not the best written instructions.  But camera is easy to use, so figured things out.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE,LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Maggie Irmiter
Reviews.Content: WE GOT THIS CAMERA AFTER HAVING OUR SON. IT IS SUPER EASY TO USE AND TAKES GREAT PICTURES. WE LOVE THAT WE CAN CAPTURE GOOD PICTURES OF OUR ACTIVE BABY WITHOUT ISSUE. THE BURST MODE IS GREAT ALLOWING US TO TAKE PITCURES IN RAPID SUCCESSION (GOOD FOR WHEN HE IS LEARNING TO WALK). AWE ALSO LIKE THE MODE TO SHRINK THE FILE SIZE OF PICTURES AND VIDEO TO DEND ON E MAIL. YOU GET A LOT OF CAMERA FOR THE MONEY!

Reviews.Title: DSC-H10 Sony Cybershot
Reviews.Author: S. Forney "MiniDriver"
Reviews.Content: Camera is a fine product that overcomes the delay factor in most digital cameras that of pushing the button then the 1/4 second delay while all people stop smiling and the action completes and then the picture of nothing memorable happens.  This one is fast for its price and will service the work I have for it nicely.Sony Cybershot DSC-H10 8.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot

Reviews.Title: Simply unreal pictures
Reviews.Author: Chester R. Larson "Chet3larson"
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera for the money period.  I tested every camera I could find and this camera takes the best pictures for the size.  Indoors and out I would say that you could not have better pictures with anything else short of a DSLR camera.  This is the closest thing to a perfect camera and lens that exists.  The 10x lens is amazing and the anti-blurring technology is great.

Reviews.Title: i am happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: B. Russell
Reviews.Content: the camera is quite compact.  what i like most about it is that my attachments from my older camera fits this camera also.  i also like the fact that you can take decent photos without the flash.  there is only two things that are minor which i don't particularly care for. one is there is not a separate view finder where you can save on battery life.  another is which i knew about before was you have to have lens cover off to engage the camera.  other than that i am really happy with my purchase.  i got my camera in a timely manner and it works great.  thank you

Reviews.Title: BUY IT ALREADY!
Reviews.Author: G. Rivera
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 8 months now and have put it through a lot of use, and I mean A LOT of use. I originally bought it for group shots of friends, parties, my numerous summer vacations and anything else. I have brought it to numerous reggae/electronic shows and the videos (and sound) came out amazing. I am an inexperienced photographer and figuring out the buttons and taking pictures is as easy as pie. My friends all have DSLRs and I wanted something that I would actually be able to work and know wha the buttons were, and this camera packs the perfect punch. Uploading the pictures and videos onto the computer is super easy also, it's basically plug-in and press 'upload'.My favorite part of this camera is its capabilities for shooting landscapes and scenic photos. I do a good amount of hiking and scenic photos of lakes and mountains are something that this camera shoots very well. After looking through the 350 pictures I took during my vacation to Canada, my brother said that a good amount of them looked like they were professionaly taken. Many friends said the scenic pictures were "frame worthy," which says a lot about an advanced point-and-shoot. Also, the zoom is excellent. While we were fishing in Canada, I was able to catch a loon landing in the lake from about 60-80 feet away.The only cons about this camera are that it doesnt have an automatic lens cover (though it comes with one) and the fact that you cant zoom while taking a video. I dont mind either; the lens cap that it comes with can be tied onto the camera so you can take it off without having to put it in your pocket, and if you want a camera that zooms while in video, get a videocamera!Other than that, buy this camera because I feel it is the best camera around the 200-300$ range. It's an advanced point and shoot with some SLR capabilities. Also, it does come with a battery but i would suggest getting an extra one since you will always be ready for extra shots if your original dies. I dont think it comes with a memory card, so make sure to pick one up. If your going on vacation for more than a week or so and will fill up the memory card, pick up an extra one. Its well worth it...Trust me, this camera will make any amateur photographer look like a pro!

Reviews.Title: Small but DURABLE Camera, takes GREAT pics!!
Reviews.Author: Zimamaxx "24/7 Admin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our office of about 35 transportation engineers. We have a small army of cameras that we take out for Field Work in the rain, sleet, and snow, and all of them must be durable and able to take detailed shots quickly in both good and bad lighting. This little guy has become a fast favorite of all the cameras, as it's easy to hold in your hand, takes steady shots in even the darkest of areas (it's all about the settings) and seems to be able to take a beating. The features are easy enough for even a novice to use, and everyone is able to upload the pictures onto their computers without any problems. A GREAT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Vacation documented with easy.
Reviews.Author: Mark D. White
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-shot Model DSC-H10 camera was bought four weeks before leaving on our 3500+ mile driving trip thru 12 states. Great pictures with quick recovery for next shot. I did purchase a spare battery for backup which was a quick recovery when notified of low battery power.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Big Rich
Reviews.Content: This camera is well worth the price.  It is simple to use, takes great pictures, and has fantastic zoom.  It exceeds expectations for a point and shoot.  People who want burst mode to work indoors with poor lighting don't buy this camera, spend the money and get a DSLR or set up your shots with the proper lighting to make it work.  Burst = no flash.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Carmen's Crew
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 Sony digital cameras, and have LOVED them all!  So when I decided to upgrade, I went straight to the latest Sony digitals to see if I could strike gold yet again with a Sony digital camera.  And guess what??!!!I DID!!!I'm a stay-at-home Mother of five and I take LOTS of pictures.  This H10 is perfect for all of the shots I take with my kids and various other things.  The pictures are of high quality.  I'll never buy a camera without the 10x optical zoom because Sony has spoiled me with that incredible zoom!  The 8.1 megapixels produce quality pictures beyond my wildest imagination, which can be blown up to any reasonable size you would need them to be!  The programs are so easy to use, that I didn't even have to read the manual to figure them out!!!  One of my FAVORITE things about this camera is that when I actually push down the button, it captures the EXACT PICTURE I WAS TRYING TO GET without "missing the moment"!!!!  I can't say that about all of the Sony's I've owned in the past.  Anyway...this is THE camera to own and is at a FANTASTIC price on Amazon.com!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: A Good Value
Reviews.Author: mlbrad
Reviews.Content: This camera appears to be a good value purchase. I like the "Steady Shot" and "face recognition" features. Having the ability to take multiple pictures in rapid succession is also a handy feature. The 10x zoom is great. It would be nice if it also came with an "optional" small hand strap, in addition to, the larger neck strap that comes included with the camera. The lens cap is not an issue, as the camera displays that you have failed to remove the cap when it is inadvertently left on. Overall, the camera, considering its features and quality of digital photographs, is a good value for the money invested.

Reviews.Title: General Pics Person
Reviews.Author: T. Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister-in-law who is not a pro picture taker....it takes the thinking out of taking pics.  Very easy to use with great results.  Nice, bright 3" screen on the back of the camera.  Battery life seems to be very good.Great overall camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSCH10
Reviews.Author: John W. Mc Manus
Reviews.Content: Found this camera very easy to use and focus.  Produces excellent pictures.  Though there may be better more sophisticated camers, the DSCH10 is small and light making it easy to use and transport.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera - still need to learn how to use all of its capablities
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Rom
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is very good, just that my skill in using it is limited.  I have been experimenting with it for the last couple of weeks and have had mostly good success.  The zoom is great since the camera it is replacing was only a 3x.  I think the zoom is causing me some concern because at full zoom I probably need to keep it extremely steady, when i do so normally the picture turns out well.  When I don't purposely steady myself they can turn out blury.  The only thing that I have found bothersome was the manual lense cap - but I knew that was a con when I bought it.  Overall I am very happy with my purchase, just trying to figure out how to best use it.

Reviews.Title: Small with many larger camera features
Reviews.Author: H. Johnston
Reviews.Content: I have a larger SLR digital Nikon and a pocket Canon, but this Sony is now my favorite, most used camera.  Convenient size, lots of useful features, fairly fast, built-in flash is more powerful than other small cameras. I like the mode wheel being visible in the view screen when the actual mode wheel is turned.  Takes great shots and the zoom is far better than most digitals.  Not as small as my pocket Canon but still small enough to fit easily into a waist pack or purse.  I like the ability to use filters with this camera and have purchased UV and polarizing filters for it. Only thing I would want to change would be to have a view finder window for the eye, which would save battery power and is better for low light viewing. One tiny problem is that while holding the camera, my hand touches the mode wheel and accidentally changes modes occasionally.  Otherwise, a great feature packed little camera!Added Mar 2009 - Took a few evening shots of space shuttle launch this month, from my home 75 miles south of Kennedy Space Center. Not only did the photos come out well, even in low light conditions, the camera actually caught the external fuel tank being jettisoned and the two booster rockets falling to earth behind the shuttle, the latter just two pin points of light, but definitely visible.  This was hand held, no tripod.  I love this little camera!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: Justin F "Tech Guy"
Reviews.Content: I spent alot of time reviewing point and shoot cameras in the $200 range and after much deliberating decided on this one. I was attracted by the built in zoom and despite some reviews that picture quality would suffer at full zoom decided to give it a try. Wow ! This is a great little camera. I also own a Nikkon d40 which I consider my professional camera and this camera takes almost as good photos. The Nikkon is great but not at all portable. This is a small professional quality photo camera that is practical to carry around. Have taken 50+ photos and they are all great. Not much need to leave automatic mode here - works great but fun to play around with shutter speed ev and other manual settings. Its not as sleek and sexy as some of the other point and shoots - in fact it looks fairly old school, but buy ths camera and you wont be dissapointed. Justin.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: Bryan I. Rittenberry
Reviews.Content: The DSC-H10 is a very good camera.  It is light weight and small enough to carry in your pocket.  The camera seems to be quite durable as well.The camera is really good outdoors, and the macro feature is excellent.  It is easy to get good macro shots with this camera.There is a bit of noise at higher ISO settings, but it is hardly noticeable up to to ISO 400 when making 8 by 10 prints.  Anything over ISO 400 and the picture starts to look bad.The auto mode will usually produce a good picture.  The manual settings are easy to use when you need more control over your camera.  I found that most of the other modes were not very useful my purposes; I usually kept the camera on manual or automatic.The flash can take a little of bit of time to recharge.  So make your shot count if you are using the flash with a moving subject.So far, I have taken over 6,000 pictures with the camera without any issues.  Overall, the DSC-H10 is a very good point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: Faith A. Sherman
Reviews.Content: I have to take a lot of portrait and close-up food  and product shots for my job. This camera has a terrific range, a very long battery life and generally, I am very happy with this smart purchase. Can't seem to find  the right camera bag, though. Don't know what the newer DSC-H-20 has-but this model is well worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: R. McLaughlin "Camera and book buff"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for an amateur to semi-pro photographer. It has a great variety of features and flexibility that allow some great picture taking. I obtained mine slightly used for $180 and it is an excellent value for the money.The pictures I've taken have come out crisp and clear. There is only a slightly higher brightness than the natural setting, but this is easily corrected with Photoshop or other software or through the camera itself. Picture selection can be set at low pixels to 8.1 MP resolution for whatever purposes one may have. Of course, if one desires to produce huge pictures greater than 15" sizes, a higher resolution camera is needed.  But for me, this is an excellent camera and I couldn't be happier with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Kristin D. Moore
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  We bought this after reading all the other great reviews and totally agree with them.  We've only had it a few days, but so far it's working great.  It has taken some really good pictures and the zoom on it is awesome.  It is really easy to use.  The video feature is my favorite.  It took a very nice, steady video of my 3 year old driving his truck.  It is small enough to be taken everywhere.  Just keep in mind that it takes a mini SD card.  Our old SD card from our other camera would not fit.  We found a 4GB mini card for this camera at Wal-Mart for $25.  If you are looking for a great camera to use for kids, and a good one for your money, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Happy with Sony electronics
Reviews.Author: Dale I. T "dittgr9679"
Reviews.Content: Own a Sony Cybershot for a few years, decided to upgrade to get more zoom and larger view screen.  Very simple to use and takes great shots- would recommend

Reviews.Title: Gr8 Camera
Reviews.Author: Dhaval Joshi
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last week for a friend & I really like the quality of the pictures....I think its the best!

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: Sergio I. Prada "Prada"
Reviews.Content: We switched from an old Canon powershot to this one. The extra $[...] bucks are worth it. Much more camera and power. The drawback is the amount of space that each picture takes. Highly recommended for quality pictures with zero expertise needed.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Dietiker "bdietiker"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes fast pictures compared to the coolpix we had before.  Pictures come out clear and of higher quality as well.  The only drawback was that you have to get a Sony Pro-duo memory stick and can't use the old standard SD card. Otherwise, great camera!

Reviews.Title: I dont understand how this camera has so many good reviews...
Reviews.Author: Jones R. Muller "Gipsy...."
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer... So, what I expect is descent pictures in the automatic mode.However, indoor pictures are absolutely horrible with this camera (trust me, I read similar comments from other users and didn't believe and went ahead because of the Sony brand).In low light and no flash the pictures come out blurry... If you use flash the face of the person is so bright and absolutely not nice.I upgraded from a smaller zoom old canon since I got an infant and really wanted to get nice shots inside of the house with him. However I absolutely cannot use the flash since will blind the poor baby...However the outdoor pictures, with its powerful zoom are great.I tried to improve my skills in using manual mode, but no luck... I'm sorry to disagree with the majority, but I'm going back to Canons... (I just didn't return the camera because I let the 90 days expire without trying the camera much)...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for anyone!
Reviews.Author: C. Kanzenbach
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a couple years now and I love it!  Let me first say though that I am a person with lots of experience using cameras both point-and-shoot and DSLR.  While this camera has some professional level settings to it, not using them is not an issue.  There are 10 different shooting modes including a sports mode and a night mode.  I haven't found the night mode to be the most useful, but I do not take many night time pictures either.  What I really love about this camera is the macro setting.  You can turn macro on and off and you can get so close to things with the camera that they almost touch the lens.  The zoom is just enough so that it doesn't blur out the pictures too much, but it gets close enough to see something at a decent distance.  The flash can be turned on and off with the press of a button, or left in auto mode.  The menus are fast and easy to get through.The only thing I have been disappointed with is the battery life.  In my experience, I have learned to carry an extra battery with me, and, if planning to use the camera, charging the batteries the night before.  I also have learned to turn off the camera when not in use, and reviewing pictures only when I get them on my computer.  I have 2 batteries and both of them only last a couple of hours (on) before they need charging.  Disappointing, but in my opinion, worth it for the high quality pictures produced.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with camera
Reviews.Author: Misty in Flagstaff
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the Sony Cybershot.  The zoom is very good especially for a point and shoot.  The organizing folders in the camera are also very handy particularly when you cant get to a computer to upload the photos right away.  We would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: can't go wrong
Reviews.Author: Susan L. Treacy "electronic mom"
Reviews.Content: this is the best i've had. it's just an all round great camera. the 10x zoom is as close as you can get to the top of the line without breaking the bank. i thought all the featured settings were pretty easy to access and use as needed. it's not a complicated camera. pictures are clear and the easy to fix if you screw up. lots of features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera even for non photographers
Reviews.Author: LaJimian
Reviews.Content: I bought the H-10 even though I went back and forth between it and the H-50. I am very pleased with the purchase I made! I have taken many photos, both inside and out, and the camera has preformed outstanding! I find myself looking for things to shoot. I am not a photographer, but love nice pictures, and this camera takes beautiful pictures.  The zoom, works very well with the auto focus,and the steady shot feature, and the video feature is better than most camcorders! This camera gets two thumbs from me!

Reviews.Title: none
Reviews.Author: Bridget Verdone "B.verdone"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of home work before getting the Sony Cyber Shot D S H10  It is a great camera,fast next shot perfect pictures without flash on the iso setting the only negative on this camera is having to remove the lense cover.

Reviews.Title: cybershot
Reviews.Author: Karl Breckenridge
Reviews.Content: this is a great product, does all I want it to do, have a high end camera but want one for knockin' around, this is it

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Tiago R. Vasconcelos
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. Great picture:Pros: Size, speed, Flash light, zoom, picture quality.Cons: Lens cap (you have to remember to take it out by yourself). It does not have Aperture priority nether Shutter priority. The Manual adjustment is also very limited for the Aperture level.

Reviews.Title: This is a great light weight camera
Reviews.Author: Jill Ayers "twinb"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband and he is thrilled with the camera. We both have digital SLR's and he uses this as his hiking, biking camera. Great shots, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Not a dainty shirt pocket digital camera, just fantastic!
Reviews.Author: E. Orchowski "metalsmith"
Reviews.Content: All it took to ruin my 4 year old former pocket digital camera was one careless drop from the breakfast table--the fragile case dented and the lens became jammed; this experience convinced me that rugged reliability trumps both "cute", & pocket-sized convenience.  Several reviews describing the DSC-H10 design intrigued me, as well as my wife's satisfaction with her Sony SLR; the DSC-H10 is only slightly larger than "pocket digitals" and I find it much more convenient than the much larger SLR.  I take pictures of construction, special projects, bids and family occasions, so my needs are not a shirt-pocket size form factor.  One of the great designs of this camera is the body (naturally cradles in your right hand.) I will probably never use the 10 minute sight/sound/motion video function, but the wide viewing screen, crystal sharp focus, and picture modes are remarkable.  Plan to order the Sony custom case as well--and don't plan to keep this camera in your shirt pocket--just expect it to work when you need it.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Sony camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia in San Mateo "Cynthia"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. My dad had it over the holidays and I liked it a lot so I decided to buy one too since my old point and shoot just wasn't the quality that I wanted. I love the steady shot feature and it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: R. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for my daughter before we went on a cruise.She hasnt put it down yet. Excellant camera for the money and the beginner photoghrapher.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Lorena Simon
Reviews.Content: I find this camera excellent for my photography needs, which are taking pictures of my family in different situations, such as doing sports, playing with friends, at parites, etc. I am no expert photographer, so I really appreciated the cameras easy-to-understand instructions and ease of use. I also like the fact that the battery lasts much longer than regular batteries. There is almost no waiting time between pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, good price, great seller
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Schellinger "Bitsy"
Reviews.Content: For the money, this camera is great. It has the 10x optical zoom for taking pictures of the kids when they're on stage. The 8.1 MP is good. The camera is not too chunky. We are very happy with it and highly recommend it. We own other Sony digital cameras and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Abhay
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for its price, specially the optical zoom is absolute fantastic. I have used in football games and got the absolutely great snaps of players. Quality is simply awesome. I love it. Easy to use and easy to click.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot
Reviews.Author: Ruth Denoyer "Fogelberg Fan"
Reviews.Content: Sony Cybershot DSC-H10 8.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom with Super Steady ShotThis camera is very good for the price.  I'm still trying to figure out all of the features.  I've had some blurry pictures, but those are usually when I'm taking pictures in dark conditions.  The zoom is wonderful and pictures are clear.

Reviews.Title: A good buy
Reviews.Author: Edward Blanchard
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use,even if you have not owned a digital camera before.0yt does have features new to me, but with the manual that comes with it, you can find directions to use all the features with ease.It also comes with software that is very usefull. Overall it is a quality camera with accessaries at a good price. Sony Cybershot DSC-H10 8.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Russell Raabe
Reviews.Content: Arrived just like it came off the shelf in the store.  After having bought a camera case and shoulder straps for the camera, I couldn't be any happier.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: just beachy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago and absolutely love it!  It takes excellent pictures and has some cool features.  Everyone who had used it loves it also. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: SLR features, but compact quality at a great price
Reviews.Author: John Morrison
Reviews.Content: I throw it in my pocket and take it to concerts and clubs and get excellent photos.  It's great in low light and I love all the SLR-type features and the flexibility/creativity they afford.  For everyday daylight or flash photos it performs very well also.  Sometimes I have to really work to get photos as sharp as I like (I like very sharp photos!), but overall I'm very happy with the quality.  And besides, that's the price you pay for a very inexpensive, non-SLR camera that comes with great portability and little stress about having it stolen, lost or damaged. I've had mine for about 4 years...it's been a durable workhorse and performs as good as new. I love it, and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!  A must buy!
Reviews.Author: Dana Larsen
Reviews.Content: My friend had this camera and we used it many a times for photographing our jewelry for our website, and I needed a new camera myself so I purchased this and it was the best Idea Ive had this year! well worth the hundred dollars I spent.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Candice La Mar
Reviews.Content: So my sister had this camera and it took such beautiful pictures that I knew I had to have it. Luckily for me it is about a 4 year old camera so I did not have to pay the original price of 400.00 and I got it for 140.00.SCORE!The picture quality is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: Good value...replacement for broken original camera
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I purchased this used camera since my son broke our original camera (exact same make/model) while on vacation.  I wanted exact same everything and got it for about $100, rather than purchasing a newer model and wasting time reading about how to use it.  Good value and now I have exact battery, lense case, charger, etc.  Camera was advertised with minor scratch on viewer, but I don't see it.  Camera was in great shape and arrived quick.  Overall, very happy 1 month later so far...

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: farice
Reviews.Content: The camera was just as described, it was delivered when promised and operates flawlessly. I was very please to find it and use it almost every day.farice belk

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera
Reviews.Author: clay a volz
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for a year and half. Easy to take great pics. The 1080 video is super. Love everything about it except that on a recent vacation must have gotten some sand or something in the lens mechanism. It would not open. I hear this is a common problem with digital point & shoots. Anyway would cost about as much as I paid for it fix so looks like a new camera for me. Will defintely look at Sony's Fugi and Nikon. Will seriously consider an extended warranty!

Reviews.Title: My wife loves this camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Rollins "Chris Rollins, PE"
Reviews.Content: And so my father bought one too.  Perfect little pocket camera with a nice zoom.  I personally go with a bigger prosumer model (Lumix GF-1), but alternatively this would make a good complement to a DSLR.Battery is on the small side, so if you are going on safari without power for a few days, either buy an extra battery or get a small car charger (Duracell makes a good one in the 100w range for $70) and bring your charger with.  Another downside is that it uses Sony 'Memory Stick Duo' media, not SD card, so not compatible with my other cameras/GPS/laptop/UPS adapters.  Wife has another Sony, so fine for her I guess.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with SONY!
Reviews.Author: Sherrill A. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is my ninth SONY digital camera, beginning with my first Mavica (that used floppy disks as the storage).  I will never use another brand of camera.  I still use a large, pro-quality SONY and this is for my purse/pocket.  I love the camera and all of the modes to shoot in.  The display is big, clear and practically tells you HOW to shoot and when!

Reviews.Title: Cyber shot
Reviews.Author: Stickman
Reviews.Content: Just a great product overall.  I lost my first one I bought a few years ago, and found this one through Amazon.  I was so happy to get another one!

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Camera For All Skill Levels
Reviews.Author: Claja99 "Claja99"
Reviews.Content: Here is a digital camera that accommodates all photographic skill levels.  Even a photographically challenged dummy like me can take wonderful pictures.  And the more I learn about the camera, the more things I can do.  I won't list here all the attributes because you can see those elsewhere, but I will say that EVERYONE can take great pictures with this camera!  And if you are interested in photography, you can go a long way with this camera.  In fact, you may never outgrow it.

Reviews.Title: Cybershot DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: milo
Reviews.Content: Camera was everything I asked for and was delivered as promised except that the vendor shipped a product received from Sony that was destined for UK so the power cord from and to the charger had to be swapped out for an American plug and not a UK plug.  $2.50 at Fry's not a big deal just confirm with vendor that they should ship an American plug if the UK unit is shipped.  Great camera though size and zoom is what I asked for. and good value on a discontinued camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: Scott Lenahan
Reviews.Content: This was my third Sony digital camera.  When I used a print SLR, I had a Nikon N90; the best...!  For the price, you can'tbeat these Sony's.  Many of my friends and my own daughter has the Cannon's.  But honestly, I do prefer the Sony for overallresults.  If I had to find a complaint, it would have to be the fact that the Sony has a manual lens cap, where Cannon is automatic.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot
Reviews.Author: valley340
Reviews.Content: I use this on construction projects, have taken couple of thousand pics, rough use, dirt,dust,etc. no problems. Good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: My Best Camera
Reviews.Author: Amby "Anime_Goddess<3"
Reviews.Content: I own this camera, I didn't buy it from Amazon though. My local Walmart had this camera brand new, not refurbrished, for $200. I don't remember the original price of this camera, but I do know I got a great camera for an amazing price. It takes great pictures as well as great videos. Even a person such as me, those who have quiet voices, it records the sound very well. I have different pictures and videos that I have taken with this camera. The camera detects faces and it has different features like those "soccer moms" would want to use the Sports feature. It pauses the picture on the camera for a split second then it saves it. It's better to use the sports feature during the day because it doesn't use flash for this feature. It's also a good camera if you have a job where you have to take photographs and you know you're going to end up banging your camera up. I have dropped mine time and time again. The battery life is great as well, it usually takes mine two weeks before it goes dead. I recommend this camera, although I am not sure how the refurbrished one would hold up, mine was new but it was around $400 when it came out at Walmart so no one really bought them.

Reviews.Title: So happy I bought this camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Plank
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes wonderful pictures and has a great zoom, but is also very easy to use and understand.  I've had other cameras that came with tons of features and settings, but I could never remember what they all did.  I felt like I needed to carry around the instruction manual to fully use and understand them.  This camera solves that problem.  It tells you what each setting is for on the display screen and makes it so easy to adjust the settings according to what you need for the picture.  If you're like me and have two young children on the go and want a camera that will take great pictures and is intuitive to use, this is the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: semi professional
Reviews.Author: David Hochman
Reviews.Content: it is a semi proffesional camera, comes with a couple of zoom covers and takes really good pictures, close and for the distance, also u can get more zoom with the special lens, and remember it is sony, what else could be better for good price and good technology.

Reviews.Title: Great for just taking pictures for fun
Reviews.Author: Tisha M. Larsen "disholicious"
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera to take family pictures and sports pictures. Very nice clear pictures, rechargable battery is definately a plus, don't really like the lens attachment- but it works great without it. Great purchase for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good camera -  a few flaws
Reviews.Author: A. McDermott
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this camera takes nice pictures and it lives up to it's name Steady Shot.  However, there are two flaws.  The Zoom button is in such a place that you find yourself zooming when you don't mean to.  Your thumb ends up on the zoom if you hold the camera by the "handle".  Secondly, I just took the camera on vacation and I found that the battery died fairly quickly - much quicker than my last camera.  I was charging the camera every evening, but still the charge did not last throughout a whole day.  So, I just ordered an extra battery, which was about $30.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Shari Storm
Reviews.Content: I totally love this camera.  The pictures are great and the camera is pretty easy to learn.  I like the fact that there isn't a lag when I can take a picture.  I also love the feature where you can take pictures one rigth after the other very quickly.  I had a Canon camera and after a few years it just died.  This is much better, especially for the cost!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-H10 photo samples
Reviews.Author: MISSISSIPPI QUEEN "Rudi"
Reviews.Content: A very small light camera. Overall excellent for travel. I visit about 7-10 countries a year, and I always travel with a camera. It is hard to pack the clothes you will need, personal items and camera equipment. I have a canon 450d but I also wanted a good point and shoot. I visited flickr files to view phots taken with this camera... and I thought it would be a good fit for me. I am very please. For quick shots and a camera you can pocket... this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: wow what a nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: i was going to get the sony h50 but i did find it very pricey. so i got this one and i love it ! nice in door and out door pictures. fast . lonng life battery. 3 inch lcd. small super zoom. love it !!! recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: sony camera
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Azarigian "bobaz"
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic, it does everything it says & beautifully. The photos are georgous and the camera is VERY user friendly.  I love it

Reviews.Title: Cybershot Camera
Reviews.Author: Diana L. Rini "livfit"
Reviews.Content: We just started using this camera and so far it is one of the best we've ever owned. Easy to use, great pictures, and sturdy!

Reviews.Title: DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: Teofilo Gomez
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use. Fast, you do not have to wait for the next shut. Tjhe 10x optical zoon works excellent.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Terry Bailey "Shari"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera for the price we have paid. The features are pretty self exclamatory. I take a lot of photos for my business and the only flaw is when picking up the camera (when it is still on) it is easy to accedently hit other buttons on the display mantel. It is real easy to use. Love the big display pictures. I would reccomend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H10
Reviews.Author: Charles Kelley
Reviews.Content: A great camera for it's size.The 10x optical zoom take excellent pictures and they are easy to download.The battery charger is compact for traveling. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: SONY H 10 REVIEW
Reviews.Author: JING NEM "J NEMETZ"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE CAMERA, THE PICTURES IVE TAKEN ARE GREAT.  I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: So So Camera, not good indoors
Reviews.Author: internetbuyer
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed in this camera. It's not consistent and takes terrible low light pictures. Extremely blurry. It is slow when you have the flash on.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Chris Kroesen
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the price.Easy to use.memory card does not fit into normal memory card slots for a computer or Wii

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Leon J. Nevins
Reviews.Content: 100%  but if u want a veiw finder you are out of luck, it would make action shots much easier. i learned that after i got it.  camera is great otherwise. worth the $.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Mark "Mark"
Reviews.Content: It's a good deal, but I found at  regualr store after more cheaper than Amazon, this was not expected, but it's ok

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: C. Dale Zirkle II "Z"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter so I have not used this camera.  She is very happy with the performance and the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Charger Mix-up
Reviews.Author: Patrick B. Gordy-stith "PBoGS"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_34410581', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_34410581loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; return false; } function cv_34410581loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_34410581loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_34410581RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_34410581RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81XQchEJB4S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_34410581preplay.parentNode; var cv_34410581currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_34410581currentClick) { return cv_34410581currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:25 MinsVideo describing my resolution of Adorama shipping the Sony Cybershot DSC-H10 with a charger that does not work in North America (where I live). The Adorama rep gave me a number for Sony customer assistance (888-476-6972) - and the Sony rep is shipping me a correct charger at no cost.

Reviews.Title: nice digital image machine
Reviews.Author: Ralph N. Rodriguez "RNoelR"
Reviews.Content: I am a Ludite when it comes to these new digital cameras. I really miss photographic paper and the chemicals, but you can't work with this stuff and kids so, I got this camera thing and it has O.K. images but not photographs. Never confuse digital imagery with photography, it really is a different thing. This one has a rechargeable battery and, if you get one of these cameras get a second battery. It has a really nice image screen and the buttons are fairly user friendly. It is O.K., but it ain't photography.
